Sentencas: La1.5Ba1.5Cu3O7 +/-delta (LBCu) complex oxide is evaluated as a Co-free candidate air electrode material for reversible Solid Oxide Cells (rSOC).
Titulo: Co-free triple perovskite La1.5Ba1.5Cu3O7±δ as a promising air electrode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: LBCu is structurally and thermomechanically compatible with La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-delta (LSGM) electrolyte, maintains the layered (tripled along the c-axis) perovskite-related crystal structure at high temperatures, and shows reduced chemical expansion with the faster elongation ongoing perpendicular to the a-b plane.
Titulo: Co-free triple perovskite La1.5Ba1.5Cu3O7±δ as a promising air electrode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Its total thermal expansion is found to be moderate comparing to the Co-based perovskites.
Titulo: Co-free triple perovskite La1.5Ba1.5Cu3O7±δ as a promising air electrode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The onset temperature of the oxygen release from the material is low, ca.
Titulo: Co-free triple perovskite La1.5Ba1.5Cu3O7±δ as a promising air electrode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: 300 degrees C in air, however, up to 800 degrees C the average oxidation state of copper remains above +2 in the oxidative atmospheres.
Titulo: Co-free triple perovskite La1.5Ba1.5Cu3O7±δ as a promising air electrode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The total electrical conductivity of LBCu correlates with the oxygen content, with the maximum of about 55-75 S cm(-1) at ca.
Titulo: Co-free triple perovskite La1.5Ba1.5Cu3O7±δ as a promising air electrode material for solid oxide fuel cells
Co-free triple perovskite La1.5Ba1.5Cu3O7±δ as a promising air electrode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Functional LBCu air electrodes can be manufactured at temperatures as low as 750-800 degrees C, with exceptionally low (for Co-free material) polarization resistance values of 0.019 Omega cm(2) at 750 degrees C, 0.041 Omega cm(2) at 700 degrees C, and 0.090 Omega cm(2) at 650 degrees C. Relatively high power output, ca.
Titulo: Co-free triple perovskite La1.5Ba1.5Cu3O7±δ as a promising air electrode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: 162 mW cm(-2) at 600 degrees C, and above 458 mW cm(-2) at 750 degrees C is obtained for the laboratory-scale LSGM-supported cell.
Titulo: Co-free triple perovskite La1.5Ba1.5Cu3O7±δ as a promising air electrode material for solid oxide fuel cells
